items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: India-U.S. relationship: trust defines partnership, not tariffs
items.summary: Sweeping tariff hikes may sting, but the India-U.S. relationship is anchored in resilience, strategic convergence, and people-to-people ties

items.title: Which came first — Madras or Chennai?
items.summary: By 1802, a Marathi manuscript reversed history. The fort became Madras and the town Chennai

items.title: U.S. gets along with India very well, but trade relationship was one-sided, says Trump
items.summary: Donald Trump cited the example of the Harley Davidson motorcycles, saying the company couldn't sell into India because there was a 200% tariff on a motorcycle

items.title: China displays modern weaponry for first time in mega military parade attended by several world leaders
items.summary: Hundreds of troops took part in the parade held to commemorate the 80th anniversary of China’s victory against “Japanese aggression” in WWII

items.title: Morning Digest: Central officials to meet Kuki-Zo groups in Manipur today; Trump says 11 dead in U.S. strikes on drug carrying boat from Venezuela, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

items.title: CRDA to acquire 1,800 acres in Amaravati for capital development
items.summary: Municipal Administration Minister Narayana appeals to farmers to part with lands under LPS as it fetches them higher long-term benefits than land acquisition

items.title: Judge orders search shakeup in Google monopoly case but keeps hands off Chrome and default deals
items.summary: The judge refrained from ordering a sale of Chrome because he decided there wasn’t adequate proof the browser served as an essential ingredient in Google’s search monopoly, making a divestiture “a poor fit for this case”

items.title: Disney to pay $10 million fine after FTC says it allowed data collection on kids
items.summary: FTC said Disney violated the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act, or COPPA, which requires kid-oriented apps and websites to get parents’ consent before collecting personal information of children under 13

items.title: Trump dismisses rumours he is in ill health, calls them ‘fake’
items.summary: “I was very active over the weekend,” Mr. Trump said, dismissing reports about his health as “fake”

items.title: Trump announces that Space Command is moving from Colorado to Alabama
items.summary: Alabama and Colorado have long battled to claim Space Command, with elected officials from both states asserting their state is the better location

items.title: When a historic election in 1977 turned Tamil Nadu political landscape bipolar
items.summary: The year has always been a source of attraction to many in Tamil Nadu, be they from politics or the cinema. Actor Vijay’s Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), which is planning to enter the electoral fray in 2026, has been fancying 1977, apart from 1967.

items.title: How dead birds, old maps are helping scientists track biodiversity loss
items.summary: A new study’s methods highlight the sort of innovation researchers can resort to in order to elicit new ecological and conservation wisdom. While field-based studies remain invaluable to understand the natural history of a habitat or species, data collected decades ago provides historical context to

items.title: Tamil Nadu Raptor Research Foundation conducts meeting to discuss conservation threats
items.summary: Tamil Nadu, home to key raptor habitats such as the Western Ghats, Eastern Ghats, and coastal wetlands, is also seeing increasing pressures on these species due to habitat loss, poisoning, electrocution, and illegal trade

items.title: Deputy CM hands over appointment orders under sports quota
‘We’re going in’, says Trump on federal intervention in Chicago and Baltimore despite local opposition
items.summary: President Donald Trump says he will direct federal law enforcement intervention to combat crime in Chicago and Baltimore, despite staunch opposition from state and local officials in both cities

items.title: Trump says he will ask U.S. Supreme Court for ‘expedited ruling’ in tariff appeal
items.summary: Mr. Trump said that he would ask for an “expedited ruling,” warning that “if you took away tariffs, we could end up being a third-world country”

items.title: Trump says 11 dead in U.S. strike on drug-carrying boat from Venezuela
items.summary: “Earlier this morning, on my Orders, U.S. Military Forces conducted a kinetic strike against positively identified Tren de Aragua Narcoterrorists,” Mr. Trump said

items.title: When Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Annadurai enthralled students at Yale University
items.summary: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin is scheduled to deliver address at the University of Oxford in the United Kingdom to mark the centenary of the Self-Respect Movement on September 4, 2025

items.title: SC orders DISCOMs to clear their regulatory assets | Explained
items.summary: If the regulatory assets reported by DISCOMs operating in Delhi are to be recovered within the four-year window set by the apex court, they need to recover about Rs 16,580 crore a year

items.title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes appointment of 26 new judges to Allahabad High Court
items.summary: The Collegium, in two separate proposals, has recommended 14 judicial officers and 12 advocates, the latter batch of which include two senior women lawyers from the Supreme Court Bar

items.title: One of two infants bitten by rats at Indore hospital dies of pneumonia, officials suspended as Congress attacks government
J&K Opposition parties express dismay over constructing Police Martyrs’ building on 70-year-old playground in Srinagar
items.summary: PDP leader and Pulwama MLA Waheed-ur-Rehman Parra said the land for the Police Martyrs’ building has been a playground for 70 years; JKAP president Syed Altaf Bukhari termed the police’s move as “deeply concerning”

items.title: U.P. government orders probe into lathi charge on ABVP activists in Barabanki, CO removed
items.summary: The incident happened on Monday (September 1, 2025) when ABVP workers and students staged a protest at the Shri Ram Swaroop Memorial University in Barabanki, alleging that the university is accepting admissions in LLB course even after its recognition was cancelled

items.title: Lessons from Gauri Lankesh’s murder trial
items.summary: The sluggish trial is not an aberration; it is part of an unfortunate trend

items.title: Ahead of PM Modi’s Manipur trip, officials set to meet Kuki-Zo groups
items.summary: The suspension of operations agreement has been in limbo since February 29, 2024

items.title: IUML protest against corruption disrupts activities at Kozhikode Corporation office
items.summary: Protest against alleged corruption and mismanagement in the Corporation

items.title: Six Pakistani security personnel, six militants killed during attack on paramilitary base
items.summary: The attack began after a suicide bomber rammed the compound of the paramilitary base in Bannu; the ensuing gun battle lasted for 12 hours, police said

items.title: Behind Maratha quota issue resolution, a climbdown by both the Mahayuti government and the activist
items.summary: Over the last few days, the Cabinet subcommittee on Maratha reservation held four meetings. Drafts for the orders were kept ready, but the government maintained that it was firm on finding a constitutional solution to the deadlock

items.title: Hyderabad launches cyber innovation hub to strengthen digital security
items.summary: The initiative, housed within IIIT Hyderabad campus, spans more than 3,000 square feet and is equipped with specialised tools and infrastructure dedicated to cybersecurity

items.title: Bomb blast kills at least 11 at rally in southwestern Pakistan, officials say
items.summary: Police said they were investigating the blast, which appeared to be a suicide bombing; no group has claimed responsibility so far

items.title: Consumer Commission comes down heavily on LIC
items.summary: The bench strongly criticised LIC for attempting to repudiate claims while being willing to issue policies to vulnerable clients

items.title: U.P. Cabinet approves formation of Outsource Service Corporation
items.summary: Move aimed at ensuring transparency and employee rights, says the state government

items.title: Student anger spills over as SFI stages protests over pending fee reimbursement
items.summary: According to SFI State committee, the State government owes ₹8,158 crore dues towards RTF in the past six years

items.title: 27 villages declared ‘sensitive’ in Faridabad as Yamuna water rises
items.summary: Residents of a few villages have already shifted to safer locations identified by the authorities after floodwaters entered their homes.

items.title: Three women held for stealing jewellery, cash at metro station
Dengue cases on rise in Delhi; MCD steps up its drive amid rain surge
items.summary: To address the surge, MCD Standing Committee Chairperson Satya Sharma said that 20 to 30 additional beds have been arranged in hospitals.

items.title: Yamuna breaches evacuation mark, residents moved to makeshift camps
items.summary: Authorities evacuate residents from the low-lying areas after the water level crossed the danger mark earlier in the day; CM assures people at a relief camp that the situation is under control; all departments on high alert and the govt. is ready to tackle any possible flooding, says Parvesh

items.title: AAP calls ‘freedom from garbage’ campaign a ‘photo-op’ exercise; Mayor cites 10,000 MT waste cleared
Sue Gray questions class-based civil service scheme
items.summary: The PM's former chief of staff says she "learned a lot from being around people from different walks of life" in the civil service.

items.title: Faridabad Deputy Commissioner visits ‘sensitive’ villages, urges residents to shift to safe homes due to rising water levels
items.summary: Deputy Commissioner Vikram Singh visited the sensitive villages to take stock of the situation and made an appeal to the villagers to shift to the safe homes built by the administration in time

items.title: Man held for sexually harassing woman police constable
Disciplinary action initiated against 94 Excise officials for dereliction of duty
items.summary: A digital system was being implemented in the Department, and permission has been given to renew the license online once every 5 years: Minister

items.title: Karnataka High Court stays NMC’s action; permits admission for MBBS course in Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College in Belagavi for 2025-26
items.summary: THe High Court of Karnataka has stayed the National Medical Commission’s decision of not permitting students to the first-year MBBS course for 2025-26 in the Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Belagavi, based on bribery allegations

items.title: BJP delegation asks BC commission to drop Christian sub-castes listed for survey
items.summary: The BJP urged the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes, headed by Madhusudan R. Naik, to drop Christian ‘sub castes’ listed in the draft list of castes ahead of the socio-educational survey of the State population

items.title: 'Fury' over Father Ted creator arrest and 'nervy bond markets'
items.summary: Father Ted creator Graham Linehan's arrest and skyrocketing borrowing costs dominate Wednesday's papers.

Chennai is a combination of the ancient and modern, says Mohan Rajan
Woman found dead after falling into a silt catch pit at Choolaimedu in Chennai
items.summary: Police said that the woman fell into the pit, which was covered with a wooden material, in the early hours of Tuesday. They were alerted after a boy, who went past the area in the morning, saw her lying in the pit.

items.title: Nagaland Assembly defers discussion on satanic worship
items.summary: The Nagaland Joint Christian Forum had criticised the decision to take up the issue in the House

items.title: Army Vehicle intercepted by Kolkata Police for reckless driving
items.summary: The incident occurred at about 11 a.m. on Tuesday (September 2, 2025) and the military truck was stopped by Kolkata Police after it came close to the vehicle of Kolkata Police Commissioner Manoj Kumar Verma

items.title: Jury clears Cardi B of assault on security guard in Los Angeles
items.summary: A number of viral moments thrust the civil case into the spotlight.

items.summary: Appoints Justice Nageswara Rao to oversee ISL tender

items.title: Asylum protests putting police under chronic pressure, chief says
items.summary: Chief Constable Gavin Stephens says police have dealt with over 3,000 summer protests and warns against an "increase in tension and polarity".

items.title: Government unable to calculate Afghan data breach cost, watchdog says
items.summary: The National Audit Office says it has not been given enough information to have "confidence" a relocation scheme cost £850m.

items.title: Google avoids break-up but must share data with rivals
items.summary: A case over the US tech giant's dominance in search allows it to hang on to its Chrome web browser.

items.title: US filmmaker in legal battle over 'Downton Shabby'
items.summary: Hopwood DePree takes Rochdale council to the High Court over control of his ancestral stately home.

items.summary: A new book on the connections between the royals and politics has revealed some eye-catching stories.

items.title: Bihar Cabinet approves plan to open seven medical colleges across seven districts
items.summary: Bihar Cabinet sanctions ₹20,000 crore to roll out Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana, approves the creation of 3,233 posts in different government departments, among other major decisions

items.title: A scheme helped prevent sex offenders committing more crimes - then it closed. Why?
items.summary: The case raises difficult questions about how best to protect potential victims.

items.title: Don't pay a fake parking fine – four ways to protect yourself from scams
items.summary: Four simple tips to make sure you don't fall victim to fake texts or payment demands from BBC expert Nick Stapleton.

items.summary: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.

items.summary: Minister Chandrima Bhattacharya said that the national anthem is written in Bengali and no person in the country can deny that

items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka moves into the US Open semi-finals after Marketa Vondrousova withdraws injured - setting up a repeat of last year's final against Jessica Pegula.

items.summary: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justices Vikram Nath and P.S. Narasimha separately remark that Governors could neither delay the wisdom of the legislature indefinitely nor impede the functioning of the Constitution; Tamil Nadu and West Bengal seek collaboration, not combat, among high offices

items.title: BJP’s women leaders slam Opposition over insults to Modi’s mother
items.summary: The pain felt by the PM is also being perceived by the people of Bihar and the entire country, says Nirmala Sitharaman, demanding an apology from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and RJD’s Tejashwi Yadav

items.summary: Lawrence Wong will hold talks with Modi, Jaishankar, Pradhan; External Affairs Ministry says the visit will provide an opportunity to review the robust relation between the two countries

items.title: Cloth manufacturers demand 5% GST for entire textile sector

items.summary: Zack Polanski, a former actor, wants to make the Greens as noisy on the left as Nigel Farage's anti-immigrant Reform UK party is on the right

items.title: COP-30 to focus on known solutions, says its President
items.summary: The UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) will hold its 30th Conference of Parties (COP-30) in November, in the Brazilian port city of Belem, a gateway to the Amazonian rainforest.

items.title: Iran says open to U.S. nuclear talks, rejects missile curbs
items.summary: Nuclear talks between Tehran and Washington, which had begun in April, broke off in mid-June when Israel attacked Iranian nuclear facilities, swiftly followed by the United States

items.summary: Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) asks Union Minister to speak on jobs instead of lecturing people on food habits
